summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that a transcript of a November 6, 2009 deposition taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, is authentic and may be received as evidence at trial, subject to standard objections.

events.title: Deposition in West Palm Beach
events.description: A deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this deposition is the subject of the stipulation to be entered as evidence.

events.title: Stipulation Filed in Maxwell Case
events.description: The prosecution and defense stipulate to the authenticity of a 2009 deposition transcript for use as evidence in the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a formal court stipulation agreeing that a transcript from a November 6, 2009 deposition is authentic.
The deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, suggesting it relates to prior Florida-based proceedings involving Jeffrey Epstein or associates.
The stipulation is dated November 2021, during the preparation for or conduct of Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal trial in New York.
The transcript is marked as potential Government Exhibit 1006, indicating it was intended for use by the prosecution.
Ghislaine Maxwell is represented by a legal team of four attorneys: Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
